text.text_translated: Two big studies were done around the world. One study, by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), collected answers from more than 40,000 people. These people included `millennials`, who are people born between 1983 and 1993, and also people who were not millennials. This study asked about many topics, such as the culture in the place of work, how people talk to each other, different ways of working, how people get paid, how they can grow in their jobs, and how they find a good balance between work and life. In addition, a different study, done by Deloitte, asked more than 10,000 millennials about their ideas on the dangers and chances for success in the difficult world of work.
